title: Spaghetti Carbonara üçù
summary: A classic Roman pasta dish with a creamy sauce made from eggs, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper. Ready in under 30 minutes!
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, cut guanciale into small cubes and cook in a pan over medium heat until crispy. Remove from heat, reserving the fat.
In a bowl, whisk egg yolks, Pecorino cheese, and generous amount of black pepper.
Drain the pasta, reserving some pasta water.

Quickly toss the hot pasta with the egg/cheese mixture and a spoonful of the reserved guanciale fat (and a splash of pasta water if needed) off the heat to create a creamy sauce. Do not put back on heat or the eggs will scramble.
Serve immediately, topped with crispy guanciale and more black pepper.

title: Vegan Black Bean Burgers üçî
summary: Hearty, homemade black bean burgers that are packed with flavor and texture. A perfect meatless alternative for grilling or pan-frying. High in fiber and protein.
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Mash black beans in a bowl until mostly smooth but still chunky.
Mix in breadcrumbs, onion, soy sauce, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Form the mixture into 4 burger patties.
Place patties on a lined baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes, flip, and bake for another 10 minutes.
Serve on buns with your favorite toppings.
